title: New /permissions Command and /skill UI
description: Codex CLI introduces new /permissions command with shorter approval set while maintaining backward compatibility with /approvals command, adds new /skill UI for enhanced functionality, and updates MCP subcommand documentation to match current CLI behavior.

community_feedback.quote: How to adjust permissions in codex so I can stop pressing 'A' every time
Is there a way to have codex not ask permissions? Like Claude's --dangerously-skip-permissions
Switched from Claude Code to Codex CLI .. Way better experience
Tried Codex after all the noise here and i'm hating it profoundly
I don't understand the hype around Codex CLI

title: Devin Review - AI-Powered Code Review Enhancement
description: Devin introduces Devin Review feature to help scale pull request understanding with AI tooling, providing in-thread responses with updates and questions to assist engineering teams review code more efficiently and understand code before merging.

community_feedback.quote: Their code still needs to be reviewed and tested, at least as much as you'd scrutinize the code of a brand new engineer
Devin will be a tool to help software engineers be more efficient and productive, not replace them
They took too long to launch imo, by the time it finally hit the market people already found it more convenient to code with normal Claude and ChatGPT
In 20 tasks, Devin failed 14 times, succeeded 3 times, and had uncertain results 3 times
Devin can execute first-pass reviews and catch obvious issues. Human review is still necessary

title: Version v0.26.0-preview.0 with Session Resume
description: Gemini CLI v0.26.0-preview.0 adds session resume feature that automatically saves every session to prevent context loss, new /agents refresh and /skills reload commands, enhanced terminal capabilities supporting interactive commands like vim and top, and improved automation capabilities.

community_feedback.quote: The tool shows a lot of promise. Coming from Claude Code, the core functionality feels solid - just needs some permission refinements to match enterprise use

title: CLI Agent Modes and Cloud Handoff
description: Cursor CLI update brings Plan and Ask modes to the command-line interface, adds cloud handoff for background tasks, implements one-click MCP authentication, and general improvements to make the CLI easier to use.

community_feedback.quote: I moved from Cursor to Claude Code (CLI). Here is what I learned... Mentions spawning specific agents with limited scopes
I was a top 0.01% Cursor user, then switched to Claude Code 2.0
5x productivity improvement with agent mode

title: Version 2.1 Release - Multi-language Support and LSP Integration
description: Claude Code 2.1 adds multi-language support for responses in any language Claude understands, Language Server Protocol (LSP) tool for code intelligence features like go-to-definition and find references, improved terminal rendering with reduced flickering, new /terminal-setup command, clickable image links, and performance improvements including faster startup.

community_feedback.quote: LSP enabling faster code navigation (reportedly 900x faster than grep-based searching)
LSP gives Claude 'real code intelligence' rather than pattern matching
Some users reported bugs with LSP server configuration
Claude Code 2.1.0 was released with 80+ new features and 1,096 commits

title: Copilot CLI Enhanced Agents and Context Management
description: GitHub Copilot CLI receives enhanced agents and improved context management capabilities, new installation methods for easier setup, new memory feature that gracefully handles Copilot running without a repository, and improved Control-C message display.

community_feedback.quote: I got the Copilot CLI running inside GitHub Actions to create 'Smart Failures'
Task agent: Runs commands like tests and builds, receives brief summaries on success

title: Version 1.13.109 - GPT-5.2-Codex Integration and Cascade Plugin Panel
description: Windsurf 1.13.109 introduces GPT-5.2-Codex model integration with multiple reasoning effort levels, adds Cascade Plugin Panel for managing MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers, and includes enhanced plugin management capabilities.

community_feedback.quote: GPT 5.2 - Codex is going to be Insane!
Mine gets extremely laggy after a couple of minutes
GPT-5.2 includes adaptive reasoning capabilities, with improved job performance

title: Version 1.13.6 - Agent Skills Support for Cascade
description: Windsurf 1.13.6 adds Agent Skills support specifically for the Cascade AI agent, along with various bug fixes and performance improvements.
